ParentCompanyName: Farmers Feed and Grain Company Inc.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Feed and Grain Red Ball RD location.

1.    Facility Policy

The Management and employees of Farmers Feed & Grain Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, our facility is prepared to work with the St. Ansgar Fire Department, the Mitchell County LEPC and any other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impact of the release to the people of this community and the environment.

2.    Facility Information

The primary activity of this facility is the sale of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received stored, and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  NH3 is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.    Worst-Case and Alternate Release Scenario

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental release have been addressed in our hazard assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.    Accidental Release Prevention Program

This facility is in compliance with the provisions of the US OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 regulation.  "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state regulations covering NH3.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form. (Section 8.3b)

5.    Five Year Accident History

This is a new facility, no accidents have occurred.

6.    Emergency Action Plan

This facility has:

A.    A written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

B.    Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Tier III (EPCRA);

C.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call the St. Ansgar Fire Department, Mitchell County LEPC, and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7.    Planned changes to im

prove safety

Since safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility, periodic evaluations are performed to assess the site conditions.  There are no specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
